title: Wales dealt massive World Cup blow as star full-back Liam Williams is ruled out for tournament
text:
Wales have been dealt a crushing blow to their World Cup hopes with the news that star full-back Liam Williams is not only out of their semi-final against South Africa but of the final too if they make it.

It can be revealed the Saracens and British and Irish Lions superstar has suffered a bad ankle injury and will not be named Wales' team to face the Springboks.

Sportsmail understands the blow is significant enough for Williams to require crutches and it will rule him out of a potential World Cup final too, if Wales make it.

Liam Williams has been ruled out of the World Cup with an injury suffered in training

Williams has been one of the standout players and helped Wales past France

It is believed Williams suffered the injury at the end of Wales' training session on Wednesday in Tokyo.

The news is heartbreaking for the player himself - who could complete an historic set of trophies if Wales lift the World Cup having already won the Premiership, European Cup and Six Nations Grand Slam in 2019 - and terrible for Wales.

They will now be shorn of one of their world-class talents for the huge semi-final clash against South Africa in Yokohama on Sunday.

With centre Hadleigh Parkes set to play with a broken hand and a sore shoulder once more, and his midfield partner Jonathan Davies heavily strapped after a knee injury kept him out of the France quarter-final win, Wales' backline will have a patched-up feel to it.

Now Williams is out it is highly likely the experienced Leigh Halfpenny, who has played just 101 minutes at this World Cup against Georgia and Uruguay, will slot in at full-back.

Veteran full-back Leigh Halfpenny will now come into the side to take on South Africa

Wales are the walking wounded with Hadleigh Parkes (L) and Jonathan Davies (R) struggling

Halfpenny, who has won 84 caps, is hardly a poor back-up having worn the No 15 shirt for years, but in the last two years Williams has been picked ahead of him as he has better game-breaking attacking prowess.

South Africa are also missing a top talent for the match. Hot-stepping winger Cheslin Kolbe picked up an ankle injury against Japan and is not yet fit to play, so Sbu Nkosi takes his place.

'It is a big blow,' said Springboks coach Rassie Erasmus.

'Everybody knows the quality of player he is and the contributions he has made. Cheslin's top end speed and agility are his strengths and he is probably one of the best players in the world in those. He is up there with Shane Williams and Damian McKenzie.

'So it is something we will miss. If you compare a 70 per cent Cheslin is not better than a 100 per cent Sbu.

'It is a blow but we have full confidence in Sbu and the way he has been playing. He deserves his chance.'
description: EXCLUSIVE: Wales have been dealt a crushing blow to their World Cup hopes with the news that star full-back Liam Williams is not only out of their semi-final against South Africa but of the final too if they make it.
authors: Will Kelleher For The Daily Mail
